Split a reference scan into a grid of cells

comparison_cellDivision.Rd

Split a reference scan into a grid of cells

comparison_cellDivision(x3p, numCells = 64)

Arguments

x3p

an x3p object containing a breech face scan
numCells

number of cells to partition the breech face scan into. Must be a perfect square (49, 64, 81, etc.)

Value

A tibble containing a numCells number of rows. Each row contains a single cell's index of the form (row #, col #) and an x3p object containing the breech face scan of that cell.

Examples

data(fadul1.1_processed)

cellTibble <- fadul1.1_processed %>%
comparison_cellDivision(numCells = 64)

head(cellTibble)

#> # A tibble: 6 x 2
#>   cellIndex cellHeightValues
#>   <chr>     <named list>    
#> 1 8, 1      <x3p>           
#> 2 8, 2      <x3p>           
#> 3 8, 3      <x3p>           
#> 4 8, 4      <x3p>           
#> 5 8, 5      <x3p>           
#> 6 8, 6      <x3p>
